segments.text: I feel bad for the woman because she’s going to have a big mess to clean up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out, and she doesn’t even realize it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s working so hard, and now she’s going to have to deal with this too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she’s completely missing it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s just one of those days where nothing goes right.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she doesn’t get too upset when she finally notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The poor woman is just trying to do her chores, and everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost feel her frustration when she finally sees the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s really unfair how much she has to deal with.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to help her, but I can’t.
segments.speaker: PAR
